alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 11 at 1:35AM PDT until April 11 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: .Above normal temperatures is causing accelerated snowmelt resulting in increased stream and river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Nevada, including the following county, Humboldt County. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Warm temperatures causing accelerated snowmelt. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Avoid normally dry basins as they could become filled with water and/or mud, causing vehicles to become stuck.
